author: sylvavio
post_text: October 17, 2016 at 7:18 PM#1Hi,What is the macro to assign a speedmaster to an effect on executor ?because - "assign executor x.y / speedmaster=z" does'nt work for Effect Executors...

posts.author: sylvavio
posts.post_text: October 17, 2016 at 7:18 PM#1Hi,What is the macro to assign a speedmaster to an effect on executor ?because - "assign executor x.y / speedmaster=z" does'nt work for Effect Executors...

posts.author: Duplicate MarkvanderMeulen
posts.post_text: October 18, 2016 at 9:59 AM#2If you have the effects directly assigned to an executor (purple executor color) tban that command doesn't work, than you have to assign a speedgroup to the effectsI'am not at a console at the moment but guess the syntax fir that would be something like: assign effect effectpool.effect.effectline/speedgroup=numberofthespeedmaster

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: October 21, 2016 at 1:53 AM#3If your effect is directly assigned to an exec, just assign speedmaster at your effect :[color=#33FF00]assign sm 3.1 effect 1[/color] or [color=#66FF00]assign effect 1 /speedgroup="speed 1"[/color]For the exec :[color=#66FF00]assign exec 1 /speedmaster=5[/color]For me it's working.And if i assigned 2 differents speedmasters to my effect and my exec both are working...But why have 2 sm for one only thing ? You must chose one...

title: macro to assign speedmaster to effect executor
